definitions.definition: Plunder taken from an enemy or victim.
The act of taking plunder from an enemy or victim; spoliation , pillage , rapine .
Material (such as rock or earth) removed in the course of an excavation , or in mining or dredging . Tailings . Such material could be utilised somewhere else.

main_definition: (Also in plural: spoils ) Plunder taken from an enemy or victim.
secondary_definitions: ( archaic ) The act of taking plunder from an enemy or victim; spoliation , pillage , rapine .
( uncountable ) Material (such as rock or earth) removed in the course of an excavation , or in mining or dredging . Tailings . Such material could be utilised somewhere else.
